  1. Engage State College

Join the Conversation on Engage State College

Engage State College is an online forum for civic engagement. Read what others are saying about important State College topics, then post your own statement. Borough officials will read the statements and consider them as part of their decision-making processes.

Open Topics

  • Community Idea Board
     Opens a New Window. 
  • Borough of State College Strategic Plan  Opens a New Window.  Opens a New Window. 
  • Tell us what you love about State College Window. sdffasdfFf Opens a New Window. 
  • Fact or Fiction? Opens a New Window. Opens a New Window. Opens a New Window.  Opens a New Window.  
  • F8 Report Opens a New Window. 
    Facebook Social Network

As with any public comment process, participation in Engage State College is voluntary; Borough officials will consider input from this forum along with all other channels for participation. When you post your first statement, you will be asked for your name and home address and whether you would like to post with your name or anonymously. Your information is used to identify those statements, which are made from residents in and near State College.

Visit Engage State College Opens a New Window. 


  1. Watch Videos on C-NET

How to View


Click on the "Playlist" tab to look for the Borough's programs, then click on the video you wish to watch. To watch a live stream of C-NET Channel 7, including LIVE Borough Council meetings, click on the playlist named "CGTV Live (Channel 7)." Select "Chapters" to view indexed sections of the program.
 

Stream Programs Online

 
  • Borough Council Meetings
  • Planning Commission Meetings
  • Transportation Commission Meetings
  • Informational Programs

Older Programs


C-NET programs generally remain available online for 12 months after air date. To obtain copies of older programs, contact C-NET at cnet@centreconnect.org.


Can't View on Mobile?


Visit C-NET's website to view videos on your mobile phone.

  1. FAQs

FAQs

  1. What are the Borough's hours of operation?
  2. How do I register to vote?
  3. How do I get the Council meeting agendas?
  4. How do I get the Council meeting minutes?
  5. Where is the Maintenance Facility Located?
  6. Where is the Municipal Building located?
  7. What is a mill?
  1. Why can’t the Borough borrow money from the Parking Fund for the General Fund?
  2. Why is the budgetary problem with revenue and not expenditures?
  3. Is the Borough running out of money?
  4. What is the difference between what Penn State University would pay in real estate taxes versus what is received in impact fees?
  5. How often does the Borough replace computer equipment and vehicles?
  6. Why don’t the local municipalities consolidate?
  7. Does the County or School District provide any financial contributions to the Centre Region Council of Governments (COG)?
  1. Has there been any movement of Penn State University to the south of College Avenue and do these properties pay Real Estate Taxes?
  2. Is there a forecast for Earned Income and Net Profits Tax related to new development within the Borough?
  3. When was the Business Privilege Tax (BPT) eliminated?
  4. How can the Borough tax rainwater?
  5. How do I get earned income tax forms?
  6. Who can file?
  7. What will I need to eFile?
